data.title: Be wary...
data.text: Dashed out of our hotel opposite during bad weather for a burrito - all the fillings, including chicken, were lukewarm and then heated again for a few more moments under a grill before being served to us. Unfortunately we were so suspicious of how long the chicken had been lying for and what temperature it had been at that we decided not to risk upset tums for the rest of our holiday and chucked it away.

data.title: Great
data.text: The food was amazing...we have a quesadilla...nachos...and tacos...will definitely visit again...and they were not very expensive

data.title: Amazing burrito
data.text:
Best burritos in Virginia Beach we've had so far! There was only one English-speaking person on staff the day we were there but the people working there understood the basics: beans, beef, lettuce, tomatoes, etc. 
Tip: no one knew what "sweet tea" was. Native language was Russian

The food was fabulously wonderful, packed full of flavor, & large portions!

data.title: Good for a snack or quick lunch
data.text: We were looking for a quick lunch after driving a long distance and Tequila worked out fine for us.  It's really just fast Mexican food made to your specifications from ingredients in plain sight- nothing special but nothing bad either.  Beer is served but I don't think any other liquor is available.

data.title: Excited to eat Mexican food...but very dissapointed
data.text: Came down to Virginia beach...thinking what I would like to eat...decided to eat Mexican food but when I got what I ordered...I was very disappointed... food didn't even look like Mexican...I ordered enchiladas...my boyfriend got burrito(it wasn't even wrapped right like he couldn't eat it)...I would not recommend this place

data.title: Not Bad...Some Simple Improvements Would Help
data.text: First, the food.  I stopped in for a fish taco and walked away satisfied.  They use mahi as the fish and have it cooked in some mildly spicy sauce.  You get to pick the rest of your toppings.  It was small but quite good.  The restaurant itself could benefit from friendlier service and some music playing in the background.  We were there for only about 15 minutes and we were there alone the whole time.  If they liven up the place a bit, the food I had is good enough to start some word of mouth.  Good luck, Tequila.

data.title: Ew
data.text: They were open during Spring Break but did not seem prepared.  The lady behind the counter was taking a personal phone call as we were waiting to order.  The smell and the food were disgusting.
